intro: Pouteria engleri, commonly known as the golden apple or cupuaçu, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces a fruit with a hard, woody shell enclosing a sweet, creamy pulp that is rich in nutrients. Its botanical significance lies in its unique fruit composition and potential economic value in the food and cosmetic industries. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
